meanings.definition: A sound or exclamation expressing surprise or admiration.
meanings.sent1: Wowf! That magic trick was amazing!
meanings.sent2: I heard a loud wowf when the fireworks lit up the sky.
meanings.sent3: The puppy let out a wowf when it saw its reflection in the mirror.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected plot twist in the movie made the audience gasp in wowf.
meanings.sent5: The colorful sunset painted the sky with a wowf of beauty.

meanings.sent1: The talented singer always manages to wowf the audience with her performances.
meanings.sent2: The grand finale of the fireworks show never fails to wowf the spectators.
meanings.sent3: The chef's delicious dessert was sure to wowf even the pickiest eaters.
meanings.sent4: The acrobat's daring stunts never cease to wowf the crowd.
meanings.sent5: The magician's tricks never fail to wowf and amaze the children.

meanings.definition: An impressive or amazing person or thing.
meanings.sent1: The astronaut was a wowf in the eyes of the young students.
meanings.sent2: The ancient ruins were a wowf to behold.
meanings.sent3: The giant cake at the party was a wowf that drew everyone's attention.
meanings.sent4: The talented artist's masterpiece was a wowf of creativity.
meanings.sent5: The majestic waterfall was a natural wowf in the serene forest.
